intro: Zahleria zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. It is often found in rocky or wooded areas at high altitudes. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is highly susceptible to environmental changes and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
